channel.title: Comments for page "The RNG Lucky Roll Challenge"
channel.description: Posts in the discussion thread "The RNG Lucky Roll Challenge"

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Pretty much. At least the reward fully meets the 11 consume cap.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: So essentially for having both autographs, all you get is a single extra pony parade, 11 instead of 10?

item.title: Autographs
item.content:encoded:
Need someone to put the exact circumstances/effect of autographs on this page into the wiki. I have Destiny and 90% Flash 20% RNG

The dice clatter out of your hand, and you lose track of them reach forward to find them..

..and your hand presses into the cool dirt of a grassy hill, lost in the shifting blades and the brilliant sun. Careful not to touch the sword embedded in the ground, wrappings whipping in the breeze, you forget what you were even looking for. Standing, you grasp the sword, knowing that you will remember this someday..

Whoa. What?
You got a FailPotion, and 11 Pony Parades!

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Well, they are "worth" that much…but the shopkeeper refuses to take them back :/ So it's technically not a lie. Just not the complete truth. But what else would you expect from the master of screwage?

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: actually, the reverse would be true, because this IS the rng. Regardless, there's no chances or rolls, so I find it a moot point unless you have the actual items required to win. On another notw, it promises a bunch of ryo, but the only ryo we get, is for selling the failpotion. dude. SO NOT COOL!!!

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
I think you got your math wrong palumatzu. If it was a fair roll, you would have had a 1/10,000,000,000 chance of NOT winning anything, any other roll will win.
There is no actual rolls involved.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
if there WERE a chance, it'd be like 1/1100000000000000(or however many zeroes) or something—or, 1/(how many people actually play the game).

in other words, INSANE chances. If you candy coat the RNG, MAAAAAAAAYBE he'll give you 1.5. maybe.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: I don't think you can. It's meant to be fail. It's the RNG's "Lucky" Roll, after all. You're not meant to win, as the text says, for if you did, you'd get an insane amount of ryo.
